Title: ​​Germany’s energy regulator suspends Nord Stream 2 certification process
Description: Germany’s energy regulator the Bundesnetzgentur has suspended the approval process for the Nord Stream 2 pipeline that will ship Russian gas to Europe.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron halts LNG output from Gorgon Train 1 due to gas leak
Description: Chevron has temporarily suspended production from the first train of its 15.6 million tonnes a year (mtpa) Gorgon LNG plant in Western Australia, following a gas leak at the facility today
Author: CK

Title: PipeChina to boost LNG storage capacity at Tianjin terminal by month-end
Description: State-owned China Oil and Gas Pipeline Network, or PipeChina, expects to complete the construction of six new storage tanks at its 6 million tonnes a year (mtpa) Tianjin LNG receiving facility in northern China, substantially boosting the terminal’s storage capacity this winter.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy offers one LNG cargo loading in end-December
Description: Sakhalin Energy has issued a tender to sell one cargo that will load on Dec. 27 at its 10.8 million tonnes a year (mtpa) Sakhalin LNG terminal at Russia’s Prigorodnoye port. The tender closes on Nov. 18, with bids expected to remain valid until a day later.
Author: CK
